name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Montana research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Montana ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Montana ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Montana research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Montana research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Montana Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Montana ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Montana Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Montana research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Montana Resources
    ☆ AC—Montana State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Montana Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Montana Record Finder

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Montana in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Montana
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Montana Minorities

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Montana.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Montana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Montana
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Montana in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Montana
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Montana Minorities

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Montana.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Montana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Montana

1. Explore Montana historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Montana History

  2. Explore Montana history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Montana

    ☆ Montana History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Montana archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Montana archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Montana archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Montana Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Montana State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Montana.
  3. Explore Montana Memory Project collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Montana genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on Montana research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Montana ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Montana city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Montana Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Montana city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Montana city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore additional links for Montana city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Explore Montana ☆historical directories by county.
QUIKLinks

  4. Explore links for vital records on the Montana Public Health site.
  5. Explore additional links for Montana vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Montana research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Montana County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Montana.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Montana Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.
Name = FamilySearch; A = Ancestry; L = Linkpendium; G = Genealogy Inc; U = USGenWeb; F = Facebook
QUIKLinks: County Records

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Montana research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Montana Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Montana Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Montana.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Montana research.
  2. Explore the Montana research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Montana research.

1. Learn about genealogy societies in Montana in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Montana Societies

  2. Explore the Montana State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Montana Historical Society site.
  4. Explore the Great Falls Genealogical Society site.
  5. Explore Montana genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Montana.
